meanings.definition: The way in which a person is raised or brought up.
meanings.sent1: Her strict upbringings instilled discipline and respect in her.
meanings.sent2: Many people believe that a happy childhood leads to positive upbringings.
meanings.sent3: Despite his rebellious nature, his upbringings shaped him into a responsible adult.
meanings.sent4: The diverse upbringings of the students enriched the classroom discussions.
meanings.sent5: His humble upbringings taught him the value of hard work and perseverance.

meanings.definition: The environment and circumstances in which a person grows up.
meanings.sent1: Growing up in poverty, his upbringings were challenging but shaped his resilience.
meanings.sent2: The rural upbringings of the children provided a strong connection to nature.
meanings.sent3: The quirky upbringings of the siblings made for interesting family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, diverse upbringings collided, creating a melting pot of cultures.
meanings.sent5: The idyllic upbringings of the protagonist contrasted sharply with the harsh realities of adulthood.
